name: places/ChIJgzsdepVYwokRJKjD0lJ4Bow
formattedAddress: 159 E 74th St, New York, NY 10021, USA
adrFormatAddress: 159 E 74th St, New York, NY 10021, USA

originalText.text:
I was very happy with my visit to Dr. Lee. I was referred to him by Dr. Greg Werner for pain in my wrist.

They booked me the same day. Registering and filling up the paperwork online was quick and easy. Upon arriving to my appointment, I was checked in, X-rays were made and the nurse assistant prepared everything for the doctor. I was ready to see him in 20min. He was cordial and after performing his diagnosis on my wrist and an echography, he quickly found the issue. He explained to me the way forward and gave me options for dealing with the issue.

All this to say, I was very pleased with my visit at NY Orthopedics, the staff was quick, professional and Dr. Lee made a prompt and efficient diagnostic while taking the time to explain what was my health issue, my options and the way forward. I can only recommend Dr. Lee and I’m grateful for him to have taken care of me.

originalText.text:
DR Lee is competent but really doesn't have the time to spend with patients
I had several hand surgeries
The last surgery failed and I had many questions and concerns
I have no use of my  pinky and the scar tissue that developed never resolved
Basically I was told to redo the surgery and was scolded for asking questions
For me personally , it's not the relationship I expect or want with any surgeon.
Maybe you will have a better experience

originalText.text: Dr. Lee and his staff are excellent. The entire experience was both timely and professional. I was provided with a diagnosis as well as treatment options. Dr. Lee took the time to answer all of my questions.

text.text: Dr. Lee and his staff are excellent. The entire experience was both timely and professional. I was provided with a diagnosis as well as treatment options. Dr. Lee took the time to answer all of my questions.

originalText.text: This was a shocking experience. First of all the office is dilapidated, full of chipped furniture, cracked pleather exam tables, urine on the bathroom floor and toilet paper on the floor like a gas station. The exam room a/c was not working and it was stifling. But that’s not what was the most poor part of this experience: I came after an accident and emergency room diagnosis of a separated shoulder. Dr. Lee walked into the room, brushed his hand against my shoulder, and that constituted the entire examination. He didn’t ask me to raise my hand he didn’t palpate the shoulder, he didn’t examine me. One would think he would need to examine me because there were no X-rays because … they could not find the x-ray technician. “He’s MIA” Dr. Lee said. Then Dr. Lee left! Literally left for the day. I was stunned, I had paid my co-pay and my insurance was paying for this non-examination and non-x-ray, and I had to march out of the incredibly stuffy room all around the office to find support staff who again told me the x-ray guy was missing. “Doesn’t he have a cell phone?” I asked. I demanded the office manager find him. Only THEN did they call their missing colleague (over an hour) and found him to administer the X-ray. It was 2pm and the doctor had gone home. I insisted that they send Dr. Lee my x-ray, and that he call me over the phone while I wait with his findings. He did. Then they sold me the only sling they had — Small, I’m 5’8, it doesn’t fit — for $83, and sent me off. Only when I left did I realize the staff had not given me my MRI scrip, the only thing the doctor had actually done. This office is a total mess. I was in incredible pain and came for help. This substandard facility, staff, organization, and doctor did not provide the bare minimum of what is required for a patient.

originalText.text: Was referred to Dr Lee for issues with my elbow and wrist by one of his partners who I was seeing for my shoulder. Dr Lee is very knowledgeable and takes all the measures necessary to treat his patients. Unfortunately physical therapy did not work for me and he performed surgery on my elbow and wrist. I'm 1 month post op and have a long rehab ahead of me. I know from dealing with Dr Lee for almost a year now that he will make sure that whatever I have to do to get better will get done. I have nothing negative to say about Dr Lee or any of the doctors at NY Orthopedics and I highly recommend them for all of your orthopedic needs.
